Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2017 07:44PM GingerGrace58 wrote: Could you add me to this group? I was almost 9 years out before my diagnosis on my remaining breast....starting chemo January 17th. Worked through my last cancer journey. I am BRAC I positive so I have chemo and another surgery to take out my ovaries. Maybe it's just that I'm 58 or maybe I'm not as dumb as I was at 49 ....worried about working with AC..I wasn't good with nausea when I was pregnant with my kids. How bad is the nausea? Can I drive to work after taking meds? Glad to meet all of you. I can't imagine doing this with young children at home. You all are brave women!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 2017 M0221 ML1209

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2017 08:04PM GingerGrace58 wrote: I am having a burning in my chest after the first AC chemo treatment. It began a couple of hours ago. I have a pic line. Going in for a Neulasta shot tomorrow. Should I be concerned?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 2017 M0221 ML1209

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2017 07:52PM GingerGrace58 wrote: I was triple negative 9 years ago. I am also Brac I positive. I also had no node involvement. I had 4 rounds of taxotere and something else. I had a mastectomy on the right side. And of course my chemo starts after my left breast mastectomy this year.Triple negative usually has a high oncotype score. But everything I read said if you made it 5 years out you were considered cured. I probably would not be facing this again if there would have been an option to take both breasts off. I found alot of survivors in the triple negative community. Hang in there!
